result.execSummary:
The defendant Ruth Shirlee Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping by Witness, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
CONSECUTIVE to any sentence.
TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by 3/30/2023 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept. Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm or body armor.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ruth Shirlee Williams

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Frederick F Klimetz in court for Ruth Shirlee Williams.  Attorney Ian Vance-Curzan for Paul Leonard Tiffin in court for State of Wisconsin.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

Court sentenced defendant to serve 24 DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 24 days served; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by 3/30/2023 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept. Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm or body armor.
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

received and filed.

Addendum to Plea questionnaire, waiver of rights.

Defendant Ruth Shirlee Williams appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Frederick F Klimetz mr. appeared by video for Ruth Shirlee Williams.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Ellen Brostrom, Branch 06.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Defense Counsel requests a PGP Hearing. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 06.
Hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Ruth Shirlee Williams appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Margo Elise Clark appeared by video for Ruth Shirlee Williams. Attorney Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brostrom, Branch 06. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT STILL NEEDS TO BE INTERVIEWED TO DETERMINE ELIGIBILLITY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in PE. 
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
